instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Water damage, very small, however, the motherboard looks dead.
Top of it, i don't have the schematics and boardview for this MB. Can you guys help me out?

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
We can't really distribute schematics here, Apple already breathes down our neck. 

This would be same as anything else, need info on which power rails are present and which aren't to go forward.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes, i know, but i don't have idea without schematics

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Did you search with Google?
Use similar schematic for the chips you find on your board.
Compare boardview from other boards, if available...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I bought the board view today and the PDF. 
The motherboard  was dead because has a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> rail.
I just inject some power on that rail and <CAPACITOR>C6622</CAPACITOR> gets really hot. So I replaced and everything works fine.

Thank you [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] for all your help.
